Dinosaur, Euparkeria

This grayish-green reptile is about the size of a small dog. Its snout is long and its mouth is filled with needle-like teeth.


Euparkeria

CR 1/2

XP 200
N Small animal
Init +2; Senses low-light vision, scent; Perception +10
DEFENSE
AC 14, touch 13, flat-footed 12 (+2 Dex, +1 natural, +1 size)
hp 13 (2d8+4)
Fort +7, Ref +5, Will +1
OFFENSE
Spd 40 ft.
Melee bite +3 (1d4+1), 2 claws (1d3+1)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
STATISTICS
Str 12, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 8
Base Atk +1; CMB +1; CMD 13
Feats Great Fortitude
Skills Perception +10; Racial Modifiers +4 Perception
ECOLOGY
Environment any land
Organization gang (2-4) or pack (5-12)
Treasure none

Euparkeria is a nocturnal carnivore, feeding on insects and small game. When moving, it usually moves on all fours; however, when running or in combat, it stands and fights on its back legs. A euparkeria can reach lengths of 3 feet or more. Skin coloration is gray or grayish-green. When attacking prey, the euparkeria stands on its hind legs and attacks with a vicious bite. Its front legs feature a small thumb-like claw that it uses to slash its opponents. Much like other small dinosaurs, by itself the euparkeria doesn't pose much of a threat. In large numbers however, they can easily catch and kill prey much larger than themselves.
